subject: Education
title: Interleaving: Mix It Up to Learn More
description: A short lesson to help you apply Interleaving: Mix It Up to Learn More.

hook.text: Baseball players who practiced mixed pitches outperformed those who blocked them.

buildup.text: Blocking means practicing one skill at a time. It feels smooth and productive.

discovery.text: Interleaving mixes different problem types, forcing the brain to discriminate.

twist.text: Learners rate interleaving as worseâ€”even though their scores prove it's better.

climax.text: The struggle of switching builds flexible retrieval routes in long-term memory.

punchline.text: Confusion during practice means clarity during performance.

quiz.question: Why does interleaving improve learning despite feeling harder?
